intro: Amblyglottis emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed amblyglottis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. Amblyglottis emarginata is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and small animals.
